title: Opposition protests as pro-Russia party in Georgia appears to win elections
content: The Georgian Dream party’s founder has vowed to ban opposition parties and take the country in a pro-Russian election. Observers allege fraud in the election.
summary: The Georgian Dream party’s founder has vowed to ban opposition parties and take the country in a pro-Russian election. Observers allege fraud in the election.

title: Families separated by Israel’s war in Gaza fear they will never reunite
content: In the early days of the conflict, parents, husbands and wives made snap decisions about where to run. Now, some worry their separation could be permanent.
summary: In the early days of the conflict, parents, husbands and wives made snap decisions about where to run. Now, some worry their separation could be permanent.

title: NATO says North Korean troops already deployed to Russia’s Kursk region
content: Such a deployment could put North Korean troops in direct combat with Ukrainian forces, and it could help Russia retake more of its Kursk region.
summary: Such a deployment could put North Korean troops in direct combat with Ukrainian forces, and it could help Russia retake more of its Kursk region.

title: Live Briefing: IDF withdraws from northern Gaza’s last operational hospital; Cease-fire talks resume in Doha
content: Israeli troops pulled back from Kamal Adwan Hospital after a days-long raid, the IDF said. Gaza cease-fire talks are ongoing in Doha, a person briefed on them said.
summary: Israeli troops pulled back from Kamal Adwan Hospital after a days-long raid, the IDF said. Gaza cease-fire talks are ongoing in Doha, a person briefed on them said.

title: IDF withdraws from Kamal Adwan Hospital after days-long raid
Nearly 1,000 people killed in Israel’s northern Gaza siege, official says
Analysis: U.S. election winner will face turmoil in the Middle East
In a warming world, English sparkling wine challenges French champagne
content: Climate change has been hard for vineyards, but also made it possible to grow the grapes that make sparkling wine in southern England.
summary: Climate change has been hard for vineyards, but also made it possible to grow the grapes that make sparkling wine in southern England.

title: How Soviet farm planning gave Ukrainian troops vital battlefield real estate
content: On the Ukrainian steppe, where it is nearly impossible to hide from drone surveillance, windbreaks are fought over by Russian and Ukrainian troops.
summary: On the Ukrainian steppe, where it is nearly impossible to hide from drone surveillance, windbreaks are fought over by Russian and Ukrainian troops.

title: As ties with the U.S. worsen, China asks: Who’s the new Kissinger?
content: Influential voices in China are openly discussing who could act as a trusted bridge between Beijing and Washington, regardless of who wins the presidency.
summary: Influential voices in China are openly discussing who could act as a trusted bridge between Beijing and Washington, regardless of who wins the presidency.

title: The world beyond the election: Middle East in turmoil
content: Whoever takes office in January will face a region being reshaped by an emboldened Israel and the rivalry between Iran and Saudi Arabia.
summary: Whoever takes office in January will face a region being reshaped by an emboldened Israel and the rivalry between Iran and Saudi Arabia.

title: Japan’s long-ruling party loses majority in stunning election defeat
content: The Liberal Democratic Party, which has been in power almost continuously since 1955, failed to secure an absolute majority in the lower house elections.
summary: The Liberal Democratic Party, which has been in power almost continuously since 1955, failed to secure an absolute majority in the lower house elections.

title: Israel met ‘all its objectives’ in strike; Iran vows response
content: “We have severely struck [Iran’s] defense capabilities and its ability to produce missiles,” Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.
summary: “We have severely struck [Iran’s] defense capabilities and its ability to produce missiles,” Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.

title: Storm toll rises in Philippines as country reels from landslides, flooding
content: Almost 130 are dead or missing in the Philippines, the AP reported, as Tropical Storm Trami hit Vietnam but threatened to make a U-turn.
summary: Almost 130 are dead or missing in the Philippines, the AP reported, as Tropical Storm Trami hit Vietnam but threatened to make a U-turn.

title: Truck ramming near Tel Aviv leaves 2 dead including driver, more than 30 injured
Europe’s pledge to Ukraine tested by Trump, politics, public fatigue
content: European leaders promise to back Ukraine for “as long as it takes,” but they face public fatigue, a weakened political center and a possible Trump comeback.
summary: European leaders promise to back Ukraine for “as long as it takes,” but they face public fatigue, a weakened political center and a possible Trump comeback.

title: Russian economy overheating, but still powering the war against Ukraine
content: Putin’s massive spending on the war is overheating the economy, but he has the resources to keep doing it.
summary: Putin’s massive spending on the war is overheating the economy, but he has the resources to keep doing it.

title: Iran shrugs off Israeli strikes, but says little about attack’s targets
Israel says it limited attack on Iran, hoping to ease tensions for now
Iran shrugs off Israeli strikes, but says little about attack’s targets
content: Soon after Israel’s attack, which it said hit 20 military targets and that lasted several hours, life in Iran appeared to return to normal.
summary: Soon after Israel’s attack, which it said hit 20 military targets and that lasted several hours, life in Iran appeared to return to normal.

title: Israel says it limited attack on Iran, hoping to ease tensions for now
content: Tehran was quick to downplay the damage inflicted by the Israeli strikes, although officials said at least four soldiers were killed.
summary: Tehran was quick to downplay the damage inflicted by the Israeli strikes, although officials said at least four soldiers were killed.

title: Vatican meeting ends and hope fades for more change under Francis
content: The pope’s “Synod on Synodality” ended Saturday without progress on female deacons, married priests or LGBTQ+ outreach.
summary: The pope’s “Synod on Synodality” ended Saturday without progress on female deacons, married priests or LGBTQ+ outreach.

title: Georgia’s Moscow-leaning ruling party leads in preliminary election results
content: The Georgian Dream party said it would keep the country out of war. Opposition liberals say it is dragging the country into Russia’s orbit.
summary: The Georgian Dream party said it would keep the country out of war. Opposition liberals say it is dragging the country into Russia’s orbit.

title: Israel strikes military targets in Iran, IDF says; Tehran describes ‘limited damage’
content: The Israel Defense Forces said the strikes against Iranian military targets had concluded. Iran says the damage was limited.
summary: The Israel Defense Forces said the strikes against Iranian military targets had concluded. Iran says the damage was limited.

title: Strikes kill four soldiers and damage radar systems, Iranian authorities say
